item.description: #Address Re-use in different cryptocurrencies Bitcoin originated a method of conducting transactions called Unspent Transaction Outputs or UTXO. This means whenever you want to spend funds from your Bitcoin wallet app, your app will send the remainder balance to a new public address generated for you by the wallet app. This makes UTXO-type cryptocurrencies require you to generate and physically give out a new public address every time you want to accept funds from someone.

item.title: Price Percent Changes
item.description: Measures the hourly percent changes in price for 2 given pairs.

item.title: Price Percent vs Volume Percent
item.description: Shows the correlation between Price Percent Change and Volume Percent Change of each pair.

item.title: Price vs Volume
item.description: Shows the correlation between Price and Volume (the actual values) for each pair.

item.title: Total Price Percent Change
item.description: The cumulative percent change indicates how much each pair has changed since 1 hour before the start of the graph (called Day 0). Each point on the graph indicates how much total percent change an investment would have made from Day 0 to that point.

item.title: Total Volume Percent Change
item.description: The cumulative percent change indicates how much each pair has changed since 1 hour before the start of the graph (called Day 0). Each point on the graph indicates how much total percent change an investment would have made from Day 0 to that point.

item.title: Volume Percent Changes
item.description: Measures the hourly percent changes in volume for 2 given pairs.
